sen.j: 茶屋（ちゃや）は、日本において中世から近代にかけて一般的であった、休憩所の一形態。
sen.e: Teahouses were common from the middle ages through to recent times as a type of rest area.
Teahouses were common from the middle ages through to recent times as a type of rest area.
Chaya,' or teahouses were common from the middle ages through to recent times as a type of rest area in Japan.
sen.cmt: 「日本において」を訳出、「茶屋」のローマ字表記を追加

sen.j: 場所を提供するとともに、注文に応じて茶や和菓子を飲み食いさせる店舗として発達した。
sen.e: Teahouses developed as retail venues that supported areas and, provided a place to drink teat and eat Japanese traditional snacks.
Teahouses developed as retail venues that supported areas and, provided a place to drink teat and eat Japanese traditional snacks.
Teahouses developed as retail venues that supported areas and, provided a place to drink teat and eat Japanese traditional snacks.

sen.j: 茶店（ちゃみせ）とも称す。
sen.e: They are also known as tea shops.
They are also known as tea shops.
They are also known as 'chamise,' or tea shops.
sen.cmt: 「茶店」のローマ字表記を追加

sen.j: 現代の日本社会において茶屋はノスタルジアの対象であり、海外にあっては日本情緒の象徴の一つである。
sen.e: In present day Japanese society, teashops are a source of nostalgia and, abroad are a symbol of the Japanese spirit.
In present day Japanese society, teashops are a source of nostalgia and, abroad are a symbol of the Japanese spirit.
In present day Japanese society, teashops are a source of nostalgia and, abroad are a symbol of the Japanese spirit.

sen.j: そのため、観光を主とした演出上の目的から、これを再現した店舗および観光施設は数多く存在する。
sen.e: For this reason, since they have been used mainly for tourism, there has been a revival in some tea shops and many used as tourist facilities.
For this reason, since they have been used mainly for tourism, there has been a revival in some tea shops and many used as tourist facilities.
For this reason, since they have been used mainly for tourism, there has been a revival in some tea shops and many used as tourist facilities.

tit.cmt: 「概要」と同義と解釈し、統一リストの表記を採用しました。

sen.j: 交通手段が徒歩に限られていた時代には、宿場および峠やその前後で見られた。
sen.e: In the days when transportation was limited to walking, teahouses were seen around inn towns, mountain passes and thereabouts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the days when transportation was limited to walking, teahouses were seen around inn towns, mountain passes and thereabouts.
In the days when transportation was limited to walking, teahouses were seen around inn towns, mountain passes and thereabouts.

sen.j: これらを「水茶屋」「掛け茶屋」と言い、街道筋の所定の休憩所であった。
sen.e: Such venues were call `public tea houses` or `refreshment shops` and, were designated rest stops along the major highways.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Such venues were call `public tea houses` or `refreshment shops` and, were designated rest stops along the major highways.
Such venues were called 'mizujaya' (public teahouses) or 'kakejaya' (refreshment shops), and were designated rest stops along the major highways.
sen.cmt: were call→were calledに修正、「水茶屋」「掛け茶屋」の表記を修正、クォーテーション表記、カンマ位置を修正

sen.j: 立場にあれば「立場茶屋」と呼ばれていた。
sen.e: If located in a rest station location they were known as ` rest station teahouses'.
If located in a rest station location they were known as ` rest station teahouses'.
If located in a rest station location they were known as 'tachibajaya' (rest station teahouses).

sen.j: また、茶の葉を売る店は「葉茶屋」と言う。
sen.e: Also, shops that sold tea leaves were called as `tea leaf shops`.
Also, shops that sold tea leaves were called as `tea leaf shops`.
Also, shops that sold tea leaves were called as 'hachaya' (tea leaf shops).

sen.j: 近松門左衛門の心中物『心中重井筒』などに出てくるような性風俗を売り物にする店は、当時「色茶屋」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: In Monzaemon CHIKAMATSU's a love suicide story ` Shinju Kasane Izutsu` there were shops that also sold services of a sexual nature and were called `colored tea houses`.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In Monzaemon CHIKAMATSU's a love suicide story ` Shinju Kasane Izutsu` there were shops that also sold services of a sexual nature and were called `colored tea houses`.
In Monzaemon CHIKAMATSU's a love suicide story ' Shinju Kasane Izutsu' there were shops that also sold services of a sexual nature and were called 'irojaya' (literally, 'colored tea houses').
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、クォーテーション、アポストロフィー表記修正、「色茶屋」の表記修正

sen.j: その頃は単に「茶屋」と言う場合にはこの色茶屋を指していた。
sen.e: Around that time the term `tea shops' was used to refer to these `colored tea houses`.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Around that time the term `tea shops' was used to refer to these `colored tea houses`.
Around that time the term 'chaya' was used to refer to these 'irojaya.'

sen.j: このほかにも、「引手茶屋」「待合茶屋」「出会茶屋」「相撲茶屋」「料理茶屋」など、様々な名称の様々な営業形態の茶屋があった。
sen.e: Even besides this, there were various names used for the range of tea house operations: `hikitejaya` (a teahouse where customers were entertained until they were taken to see the high-ranking courtesan), deaijaya (a meeting tea-house), `sumo-jaya` (sumo teahouse), `Ryorijaya` (restaurant) etc.

Even besides this, there were various names used for the range of tea house operations: `hikitejaya` (a teahouse where customers were entertained until they were taken to see the high-ranking courtesan), deaijaya (a meeting tea-house), `sumo-jaya` (sumo teahouse), `Ryorijaya` (restaurant) etc.

Even besides this, there were various names used for the range of tea house operations: 'hikitejaya' (a teahouse where customers were entertained until they were taken to see the high-ranking courtesan), 'machiai-jaya' (tea house to lend seats and tables, or rooms), 'deaijaya' (a meeting tea-house), 'sumo-jaya' (sumo teahouse), 'ryorijaya' (restaurant) etc.
sen.cmt: 「待合茶屋」を訳出、クォーテーション表記修正、余分なスペース消去、他に合わせ、Ryorijaya→ryorijayaとしました。(用語集参照)

sen.j: 料理茶屋の中には、江戸時代に創業して現在も料亭として営業している店もある。
sen.e: Amongst the `Ryorijaya` (restaurant) teahouses, there are establishments that were established in the Edo period and still operate as Japanese restaurants to this day.
Amongst the `Ryorijaya` (restaurant) teahouses, there are establishments that were established in the Edo period and still operate as Japanese restaurants to this day.
Amongst the 'ryorijaya' teahouses, there are establishments that were established in the Edo period and still operate as Japanese restaurants to this day.
sen.cmt: ryorijayaとし、既出のため補足削除、クォーテーション表記修正

sen.j: 現代の日本では、主に観光地や名勝で営業しており、土産屋を兼業している場合も多い。
sen.e: In present day Japan, they mainly operate in sight seeing areas and places of scenic beauty and, in many cases also sell gifts and souvenirs.
In present day Japan, they mainly operate in sight seeing areas and places of scenic beauty and, in many cases also sell gifts and souvenirs.
In present day Japan, they mainly operate in sight seeing areas and places of scenic beauty and, in many cases also sell gifts and souvenirs.

sen.j: そのほか、「茶屋」という言葉が現代日本人に与える郷愁のイメージを屋号に採り入れ、「○○茶屋」とする飲食店も目立つ。
sen.e: Besides them, the word `teahouse` is prominent amongst a number of restaurants as it is a word in a business name that evokes as sense of nostalgia amongst modern day Japanese.
Besides them, the word `teahouse` is prominent amongst a number of restaurants as it is a word in a business name that evokes as sense of nostalgia amongst modern day Japanese.
Besides them, the word 'chaya' is prominent amongst a number of restaurants as it is a word in a business name that evokes as sense of nostalgia amongst modern day Japanese.
sen.cmt: 原文の内容より、`teahouse`→'chaya'としました。クォーテーション表記修正

tit.e: Tea houses seen in ukiyoe (traditional Japanese wood block prints).
Tea houses seen in ukiyoe (traditional Japanese wood block prints).
Tea Houses Seen in Ukiyoe (Traditional Japanese Wood Block Prints)

sen.j: 名所絵（浮世絵による風景画）の中には茶屋を描いたものがいくつか見える。
sen.e: Pictures of teahouses can be seen in a number of scenic wood block prints depicting famous places.
Pictures of teahouses can be seen in a number of scenic wood block prints depicting famous places.
Pictures of teahouses can be seen in a number of scenic wood block prints depicting famous places.

sen.j: 最低限の物しか置いていない簡素な出茶屋もあれば、いかにも繁盛している様子の大きな茶屋もある。
sen.e: In minimalistic works a simple teahouse is used whereas, there are examples where use of a grand teahouse conveys a feeling of a greater degree of prosperity.
In minimalistic works a simple teahouse is used whereas, there are examples where use of a grand teahouse conveys a feeling of a greater degree of prosperity.
In minimalistic works a simple teahouse is used whereas, there are examples where use of a grand teahouse conveys a feeling of a greater degree of prosperity.
